Dear Ms. Aufdemberge:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
February 8, 2023. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the
contract and MISEP requirements, a written corrective action plan is required. It should
be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and your
contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must
include the following:
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at 734-395-0920.
Sincerely,
Deborah Will, Licensing Consultant

II. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
2.) The facility is in compliance with all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) The facility is in compliance wi th all MDHHS Contract/Policy requirements.
III. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
None at this time.
IV. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
Social Service Supervisors are reminded to check time frames on treatment plans for
accuracy prior to approving/signing them. The end date on the last UTP before
discharge should be the youth's date of discharge if it is less than 90 days after the
previous UTP's timeframe. Otherwise, if the youth is discharged within 30 days of the
last UTP, the final timeframe of contacts and progress should be documented on the
foster care action summary/discharge plan.
V. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
The facility submitted one corrective action plan resulting from the 2022 Renewal
Inspection with the following violations:
R 400.4113 Employee records (c) (j)
R 400.4128 Initial staff orientation and ongoing staff training (1) (a) & (3)
R 400.4152 Initial documentation (c)
RFCAN 2.10 pg 27 Planned discharge mediation (DHHS – 5921)
Rose Hall, the only building now associated with this license, has been under
renovation and vacant since March 2022. I toured the building on 2/8/23 as part of the
current inspection. The following updates have been made:
• Freshly painted bedrooms and personal living spaces
• Secure wing doors replaced
• New shelving furniture in personal spaces
1

• New furniture in general living areas
• New mattresses
• New protective casings around wall-mounted televisions
• New window treatments in general living areas
• New privacy desks for phone calls/homework
• New calming rooms on each wing and one large sensory room in general area
• New round hard plastic tables in general activity/craft room
• New refrigerator, sink, dishwasher, stove, countertop and cabinets in kitchen
VI. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract and policy. It is
recommended that the facility continue on their regular license.
